vision.notes: As box jellyfish, Alatinidae likely possess rhopalia containing ocelli and lens-bearing eyes, enabling image formation and light detection. This is inferred from knowledge of other cubozoans.

mechanoreception.notes: Jellyfish generally possess mechanoreceptors to detect changes in water pressure and movement. This is vital for navigation and prey detection. Inferred from knowledge of other cubozoans.

chemoreception.notes: Likely used for detecting prey and potentially for intraspecific communication. Inferred from knowledge of other cubozoans.
